message:
Jobs go to EgyptianGeeksJobs.

Job ads posted here will be deleted, often without warning.

data.message: You should send warning before deleting it because in one of group admin's status before he said job post "ACCEPTED" here, so if you changed your policy then you should send warning or at least post a new status concerning your new policy

Khaled Ramadan Not really, no. This new policy has been in effect for sometime now and we've been sending out warnings to quite a few of these misplaced job ads. The policy is clear, do read it.

The admin status you're referring to was in fact a really old poll and the new policy has been discussed previously, in two pinned statuses one of which was an announcement.

The new group has been there since July 11. The new group was made specifically to move posts from here. Any member old enough to see discussions before that is expected to have seen this too and a few warned job posts. It's new members that find it hard to comply. I do not blame them for not reading group description well, it's not common to do so in facebook groups.
If I add a comment to a post, then delete the post. Does the post author still get to see my comment?

They might. If they have email notification on comments, and if facebook sent the email before the post was deleted (a big IF), and if they read those notifications (don't get buried by Gmail, categories, etc.)
So, quite unlikely, although *might* be possible.
I guess making Meligy's post (this very post, above) a sticky one is enough as warning :)
